meanings.definition: Not easily moved or shaken; securely fixed in place.
meanings.sent1: She stood firm on the ground during the earthquake.
meanings.sent2: The tree's roots were firm in the soil.
meanings.sent3: The firm grip of the toddler on the toy was impressive.
meanings.sent4: His belief in justice was as firm as a mountain.
meanings.sent5: The firm handshake showed his confidence.

meanings.sent1: The law firm specialized in corporate cases.
meanings.sent2: My uncle works at a successful accounting firm.
meanings.sent3: The firm's office was filled with busy employees.
meanings.sent4: The advertising firm came up with a creative campaign.
meanings.sent5: Starting a new firm requires careful planning.

meanings.definition: To make something more solid or stable.
meanings.sent1: He used nails to firm the loose boards on the deck.
meanings.sent2: The chef firmed the dough before baking.
meanings.sent3: She firmed her resolve to finish the marathon.
meanings.sent4: The workout routine helped firm her muscles.
meanings.sent5: Adding more support beams will firm the structure.
